contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in an active form. Alternate translation: "Let us praise the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: εὐλογητὸς ὁ Θεὸς καὶ Πατὴρ τοῦ Κυρίου ἡμῶν, Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ
contextId.glQuote: May the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ be praised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God chose us to be heirs" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we were appointed as heirs

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God chose us ahead of time" or "God chose us long ago" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We were decided on beforehand

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in the active tense. Alternate translation: that God may enlighten your heart" or "that God may enlighten your understanding" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: Possible meanings are 1) "every name that man gives" or 2) "every name that God gives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: every name that is named

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in an active form. Alternate translation: "God saved us because of his great kindness toward us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: by grace you have been saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: God's kindness to us is the reason he made it possible for us to be saved from judgment if we simply trust in Jesus. Alternate translation: "God saved you by grace because of your faith in him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τῇ γὰρ χάριτί ἐστε σεσῳσμένοι διὰ πίστεως
contextId.glQuote: For by grace you have been saved through faith

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated with an active form. Alternate translation: "by what people call" or "by those whom people call" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: by what is called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in the active tense. Alternate translation: "God has built you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You have been built

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated as active. Alternate translation: "God is also building you together" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you also are being built together

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "according to what God revealed to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: according to the revelation made known to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God did not make these things known to people in the past" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὃ ἑτέραις γενεαῖς οὐκ ἐγνωρίσθη τοῖς υἱοῖς τῶν ἀνθρώπων
contextId.glQuote: In other generations this truth was not made known to the sons of men

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But now the Spirit has revealed it" or "But now the Spirit has made it known" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But now it has been revealed by the Spirit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "God, who created all things, kept this plan hidden for long ages in the past" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τοῦ μυστηρίου, τοῦ ἀποκεκρυμμένου ἀπὸ τῶν αἰώνων ἐν τῷ Θεῷ, τῷ τὰ πάντα κτίσαντι
contextId.glQuote: the mystery hidden for ages in God who created all things

contextId.occurrenceNote: The act of naming here probably also represents the act of creating. Alternate translation: "who created and named every family in heaven and on earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἐξ οὗ πᾶσα πατριὰ ἐν οὐρανοῖς καὶ ἐπὶ γῆς ὀνομάζεται
contextId.glQuote: from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God called you to have one confident hope in your calling" or "there is one thing that God also chose you to be confident in and expect him to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἐκλήθητε ἐν μιᾷ ἐλπίδι τῆς κλήσεως ὑμῶν
contextId.glQuote: you were called in one certain hope of your calling

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated using an active form. Alternate translation: "God has given grace to each one of us" or "God gave a gift to each believer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἑνὶ ... κάστῳ ἡμῶν ἐδόθη ἡ χάρις
contextId.glQuote: To each one of us grace has been given

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Because they do not know God, they cannot live the way God wants his people to live" or "They have cut themselves off from the life of God by their ignorance" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἀπηλλοτριωμένοι τῆς ζωῆς τοῦ Θεοῦ, διὰ τὴν ἄγνοιαν τὴν οὖσαν ἐν αὐτοῖς
contextId.glQuote: alienated from the life of God because of the ignorance that is in them

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "Jesus' people have taught you" or 2) "someone has taught you because you are Jesus' people." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you were taught in him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be translated with an active form. Alternate translation: "to allow God to change your attitudes and thoughts" or "to allow God to give you new attitudes and thoughts" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἀνανεοῦσθαι ... τῷ πνεύματι τοῦ νοὸς ὑμῶν
contextId.glQuote: to be renewed in the spirit of your minds

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that God might give me the word" or "God might give me the message" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that a message might be given to me
